title: How does the proportion of adults with a learning disability who live in their own home or with their family vary across England?
analysis_commentary:
In 2016-17, there were large regional differences throughout England in terms of the proportion of adults with a learning disability who live in their own home or with their family. The highest proportions were found in the three most northern regions (North East, North West and Yorkshire and the Humber). The three most southern regions (London, South East and South West) were amongst the lowest. The North East had the highest proportion of adults with a learning disability who live in their own home or with their family (88%) and the West Midlands had the lowest proportion (70.3%).

Updated January 2018.
data_source: NHS Digital, Adult Social Care Outcomes Framework
